docblock.description: Adds a filter to the class. Filters are for modifying a value within a class and should not interpet the normal flow within the method.

tag.description: The name of the method the filter is in

tag.description: The method in the class that the parameters will be passed too.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Options that can be set for further modifying the filter. -'object' string: If the method being called is static, static should be inserted. If its in an instance, 'instance' should be set. Default is set to static. -'event' string: Associate this filter with an event. -'type' string: The type of function being called. Default is class_method but if the function is a closure, set the type to be 'closure' and make the $filter_method the closure

docblock.description: PVResponse is responsible for sending HTTP responses back to a client.
A list of generic HTTP Statuses
A collection of items that belong to this class
A collection of dynamically added methods that below to this class
The adapters that have been added
Observers that have been added
Instances for singleton that have added
Intercepting filters that have been added
Boolean for following and logging adapters that have been added
Boolean for following and logging filters that have been added
Boolean for following and logging observers that have been added.
The initalizer for the static class

tag.name: param
tag.description:
A list of options for initalizing the class

  • array 'status_messages' This is the ability to add in custom status messages

tag.name: param
tag.description: The status is the status code that will be sent as a header

tag.description: The content of that will be displayed to the user. If no body is set, a default html template will be display with the status code

tag.description: An array of options that define how content will be displayed -'content_type' string: The type of content that will be displayed. Default is text/html -'message' string: A message that can be displayed us no body is set. Default is empty string.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Options that can be set for further modifying the filter. -'object' string: If the method being called is static, static should be inserted. If its in an instance, 'instance' should be set. Default is set to static. -'event' string: Associate this filter with an event. -'type' string: The type of function being called. Default is class_method but if the function is a closure, set the type to be 'closure' and make the $filter_method the closure

docblock.description: PVPatterns is the parent class for implementing Adapters, Observers, Intercepting Filters and Singletons on instances.
docblock.long-description: Prodgiyview comes with 4 design patterns that can be extended to any object: Adapters, Observers, Intercepting Filters and Singletons. By extending this class to any object that can be instantiated, they will have the capability of using these design patterns.

docblock.description: The adapters that have been stored
Observers that have been stored
Get stores instance f singletons
Filters that have been stored
The boolean for following and printing out adapters as they are called
Boolean for following and printing out filters as they are called
The Boolean for following and printing out observers as they are called

Adapters allows a method to be completely overwritten by calling a different class with the same method name. Adapters can also be used with closures. The adapter uses a strategy/adapter design pattern.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The class that contains the function the adapter will respond too

tag.name: param
tag.description: The method called that will have the adapter to be called.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The new class to be called that has the same method name

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of options that be called -'object' string : Assumes that default method in the class to be called is static. If called object needs to be instantiated, change to object to 'instance' and one will be created before the adapter calls the function -'call_method' string: By default the method to be called to override the current one should be the same name. But this can be ovveridden to call a different method. -'type' string: The type of method being called. Default is class_method but if the method is a closure, set the type to be 'closure' and make the $trigger_method the closure

docblock.description: Will add an adapter for every method in the trigger_class to another class. The method will only be adapted to another class if the method in the trigger class has an adapter. This functionality can be very similiar to DI.

tag.name: param
tag.description: This can either be the name of the class or an object whose methods will be adapted to another class.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The call class is the classes methods that will be called in place of the methods in the trigger_class.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Options that be used to further distinguish the behavior of the adapters added -'object' string: Determines if the object being adapted to is static or an instance.Default is static -'call_class' string: The name of the class that the methods will be adapted too. -'class' string: The name of the whose methods will be adapted to another class

tag.description: Add ability to use singleton classes

docblock.description: PVVideo is a class designed to manipulate video files and transcoding to various formats.
The type of convet to use, default is ffmpeg
A collection of items that belong to this class
A collection of dynamically added methods that below to this class
The adapters that have been added
Observers that have been added
Instances for singleton that have added
Intercepting filters that have been added
Boolean for following and logging adapters that have been added
Boolean for following and logging filters that have been added
Boolean for following and logging observers that have been added.
Initialize the static class. Currently can be used for modifying the default converter tool and its location, which is simply ffmpeg.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of configurations -'converter' string: The converter tool and its location. Default is ffmpeg

docblock.description: Convert the video file using a converter to another format or a different settings of the same format.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The location of the file that is going to be converted

tag.name: param
tag.description: The location of the new file

tag.name: param
tag.description: Options that can control how the conversion takes place. 'conveter' string: The convert to be used and the location. Default is ffmpeg. To further define either added the path to the converter + ffmpeg or path to another converter besides ffmpeg. 'input' array: Should be an array that of options for how to treat the input file. The options should be the same options passed through the setEncodingOptions except the prefix should have 'input'. For example if the option is 'ar' as in setEncodingOptions, add 'inputar' as the option key. 'output' array: Should be an array that of options for how to treat the output file. The options should be the same options passed through the setEncodingOptions except the prefix should have 'output_'. For example if the option is 'ar' as in setEncodingOptions, add 'input_ar' as the option key.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The output is not returned but a new file will be created if the conversion succeeded

docblock.description: The encoding options on how to encode a file using FFMPPEG. The options should be run in a command line formated. The current formmating will only handle options passed through that deal with video manipulation

tag.name: param
tag.description: Defined options to be used in the conversion. Options relate to those passed in a normal FFMPEG command line fashion.The key of the array corresponds the command and the value responds to the command value.

tag.name: param
tag.description: If the options have a prefix in front of the key, the prefix should be defined either.

tag.name: return
tag.description: $options A string of options that should be used on the command line with ffmpeg

tag.name: todo
tag.description: find ffmpeg documentation and use isset to remove notices

docblock.description: Adapters allows a method to be completely overwritten by calling a different class with the same method name. Adapters can also be used with closures. The adapter uses a strategy/adapter design pattern.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The class that contains the function the adapter will respond too

tag.name: param
tag.description: The method called that will have the adapter to be called.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The new class to be called that has the same method name

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of options that be called -'object' string : Assumes that default method in the class to be called is static. If called object needs to be instantiated, change to object to 'instance' and one will be created before the adapter calls the function -'call_method' string: By default the method to be called to override the current one should be the same name. But this can be ovveridden to call a different method. -'type' string: The type of method being called. Default is class_method but if the method is a closure, set the type to be 'closure' and make the $trigger_method the closure

tag.name: todo
tag.description: add ability to adapt singleton class

docblock.description: Will add an adapter for every method in the trigger_class to another class. The method will only be adapted to another class if the method in the trigger class has an adapter. This functionality can be very similiar to DI.

tag.name: param
tag.description: This can either be the name of the class or an object whose methods will be adapted to another class. The class should be included or be autoloaded by this point.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The call class is the classes methods that will be called in place of the methods in the trigger_class. These class does not have to be included as this point.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Options that be used to further distinguish the behavior of the adapters added -'object' string: Determines if the object being adapted to is static or an instance.Default is static -'call_class' string: The name of the class that the methods will be adapted too. -'class' string: The name of the whose methods will be adapted to another class

tag.description: Add ability to use singleton classes

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the method that will be fired when the event occurs

tag.name: param
tag.description: Options to further the define the firing of an event -'object' string : If the method being called is static, should be set to static. Else set to instance -'class' stinrg : The name of the class to be called. Default is the class that is passed in. -'method' string: The name of the method to be called. Default is the method that is passed in. -'type' string: The type of function being called. Default is class_method but if the function is a closure, set the type to be 'closure' and make the $method the closure

tag.description: Options that can be set for further modifying the filter. -'object' string: If the method being called is static, static should be inserted. If its in an instance, 'instance' should be set. Default is set to static. -'event' string: Associate this filter with an event. -'type' string: The type of function being called. Default is class_method but if the function is a closure, set the type to be 'closure' and make the $filter_method the closure

docblock.description: PVSecurity is a class designed to handle the security of your application ranging from encryption to hashing.

tag.name: TODO
tag.description: rework classs

docblock.description: A collection of items that belong to this class
A collection of dynamically added methods that below to this class
The adapters that have been added
Observers that have been added
Instances for singleton that have added
Intercepting filters that have been added
Boolean for following and logging adapters that have been added
Boolean for following and logging filters that have been added
Boolean for following and logging observers that have been added.
Initializes the security class for using encryption and for authentication. Requires that the package mcrypt be installed.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of arguments to be passed into the security class. -'mcrypt_algorithm' string : The algorthim to be used for encruption. MCRYPT_DES is default -'mcrypt_algorithm_directory' string: The directory the algorithm -'mcrypt_mode' string : The mode to set for mcrypt. Defaults of 'ofb' -'mcrypt_key' string: The default key that will be used for encryption -'mcrypt_iv' string: The iv the will be used for encryption -'salt' string: The default value that will be applied as a salt when hashing -'auth_table' string: The table name that will perform authorization of a user. Default name is users -'auth_hashed_fields' array: An array of fields that will be hashed on authentication -'auth_encrypted_fields' array: An array of fields that will be encryped on authentication -'save_cookie' boolean: Enable the saving of variables to a cookie on save -'save_session' boolean: Enable the saving the variables to a session on authentication -'cookie_fields' array: An array of fields pulled from the auth table that will be saved to the cookie on authentication -'session_fields' array: An array of fields pulled from the auth table that will be saved to the session on authentication

docblock.description: Encrypts a string of data and returns the encrypted string.

tag.description: The string to be encrypted

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of options to configure the encryption

tag.name: return
tag.description: $encrypted_string Returns an encryped string of data

tag.name: param
tag.description: The string to be decrypted

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of options that defines how to perform the encryption

tag.name: return
tag.description: $decrypted_string The string decrypted

docblock.description: Returns the default arguements for encryptions. The arguements returned are initial set in the init.

tag.name: return
tag.description: $configuration Returns the configuration in an array

docblock.description: Checks to the if the credentials passed match the credentials stored in the database.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of fields that will be checked against the fields in the database table

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of options -'auth_table' string: The table name to be checked against -'auth_hashed_fields' array: An array of fields that must be hashed before checking -'auth_encrypted_fields' array: An array of fields that must be encrypted before checking -'format_table' boolean: Will formated the table with any prefixes or schemas. Default is false. -'save_cookie' boolean: If authenticated save data into cookie. Default is true. -'save_session' boolean: If authenticated, save data into session. Default is true -'cookie_fields' array: The fields that will be saved into the cookie -'session_fields' array: The fields that will be saved into the session

tag.name: return
tag.description: If authenticated, the return will be the row in the database. Otherwise false.

tag.description: $hashed_string Returns the hashed string

docblock.description: PVMail is responsible for sending email from the application.
The SMTP Host
The login user for SMTP
The login password for SMTP
The port for SMTP. Normally is 587
Which mailer to use, default is php, other option is smtp
The default from email to when sending emails
A collection of items that belong to this class
A collection of dynamically added methods that below to this class
The adapters that have been added
Observers that have been added
Instances for singleton that have added
Intercepting filters that have been added
Boolean for following and logging adapters that have been added
Boolean for following and logging filters that have been added
Boolean for following and logging observers that have been added.
Configure the mail class with default options to be used.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The options that will configure the class -'smtp_host' string: The stmp host for sending email over smtp -'smtp_username' string: The username for sending email using smtp -'smtp_password' string: The password for the user sending email over smtp -'smtp_port' int: The port for sending email over smtp -'mailer' string: The email client used for sending email. Default is 'php' but if the email client is smtp, the value should be 'smtp' -'default_sender 'string: The email address that will be used to send an email if none is defined.

docblock.description: Sends an email to a location. The is function uses the optionsset in the configuration file for determing how the email will be sent.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Arguements that define how the email be will be sent -'receiver' string: The email address of the user that will recieve the email -'sender' string: The email address of the user that sent the email -'subject' string: The subject of the email that is being sent -'message' string: The message in the email -'carboncopy' string: Email addresses to send a carbon copy too. Optional. -'blindcopy' string: Email address to send a blind copy too. Optional. -'attachment' string: The location of a file to be attached to the email. Optional. -'reply_to' string: The email to send a reply too. Optional -'message_id' string: The header for the message id. Optional. -'errors_to' string: The email addrss to send errors to. Optional. -'return_path': string: Set the return path. Optional.

Optional. -'blindcopy' string: Email address to send a blind copy too. Optional. -'attachment' string: The location of a file to be attached to the email. Optional. -'reply_to' string: The email to send a reply too. Optional -'message_id' string: The header for the message id. Optional. -'errors_to' string: The email addrss to send errors to. docblock.description: Adapters allows a method to be completely overwritten by calling a different class with the same method name. Adapters can also be used with closures. The adapter uses a strategy/adapter design pattern.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The class that contains the function the adapter will respond too

tag.name: param
tag.description: The method called that will have the adapter to be called.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The new class to be called that has the same method name

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of options that be called -'object' string : Assumes that default method in the class to be called is static. If called object needs to be instantiated, change to object to 'instance' and one will be created before the adapter calls the function -'call_method' string: By default the method to be called to override the current one should be the same name. But this can be ovveridden to call a different method. -'type' string: The type of method being called. Default is class_method but if the method is a closure, set the type to be 'closure' and make the $trigger_method the closure

tag.name: todo
tag.description: add ability to adapt singleton class

docblock.description: Will add an adapter for every method in the trigger_class to another class. The method will only be adapted to another class if the method in the trigger class has an adapter. This functionality can be very similiar to DI.

tag.name: param
tag.description: This can either be the name of the class or an object whose methods will be adapted to another class. The class should be included or be autoloaded by this point.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The call class is the classes methods that will be called in place of the methods in the trigger_class. These class does not have to be included as this point.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Options that be used to further distinguish the behavior of the adapters added -'object' string: Determines if the object being adapted to is static or an instance.Default is static -'call_class' string: The name of the class that the methods will be adapted too. -'class' string: The name of the whose methods will be adapted to another class

tag.name: todo
tag.description: Add ability to use singleton classes

docblock.description: Calls an adapter for this class. The easiest way of implementing an adapter is by placing the adapter at the top of the function that it is being called in. An infinite amout of parameters can be passed to the adapter BUT the parameters should be the same as the parents.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the class the adapter is in

tag.name: param
tag.description: THe name of the method the class is being called from.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An infiniate amout of parameters to passed to this class.

tag.name: return
tag.description: $value A value that the adapter returns

tag.description: The associated method

tag.description: $hasAdapter Returns true if it has an adapter or false if it doesn not

tag.description: class The associated class the function is calling

tag.name: param
tag.description: The associated method

tag.name: param
tag.description: class The associated class the function is calling

docblock.description: Adds an observer to the class. Observer events can fired in any method to trigger a response.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the event that will cause a certain class and method to fire

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the class that contains the function that will be fired for this event

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the method that will be fired when the event occurs

tag.name: param
tag.description: Options to further the define the firing of an event -'object' string : If the method being called is static, should be set to static. Else set to instance -'class' stinrg : The name of the class to be called. Default is the class that is passed in. -'method' string: The name of the method to be called. Default is the method that is passed in. -'type' string: The type of function being called. Default is class_method but if the function is a closure, set the type to be 'closure' and make the $method the closure

docblock.description: Calls any functions that have been added to the observer if the event is present in the observers array.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the even that occured that will trigger notifies

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of infinite arguements that will passed to each function related to the event

docblock.description: Removes all the observers assoicated with an event.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The event to remove all the observers from

docblock.description: Adds a filter to the class. Filters are for modifying a value within a class and should not interpet the normal flow within the method.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the class the filter is going in

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the method the filter is in

tag.name: param
tag.description: The class that the filter resides in.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The method in the class that the parameters will be passed too.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Options that can be set for further modifying the filter. -'object' string: If the method being called is static, static should be inserted. If its in an instance, 'instance' should be set. Default is set to static. -'event' string: Associate this filter with an event. -'type' string: The type of function being called. Default is class_method but if the function is a closure, set the type to be 'closure' and make the $filter_method the closure

docblock.description: Apply a fitler if filter is set.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the class the filter is in

tag.name: param
tag.description: The method the filter is in

tag.name: param
tag.description: The data that is being passed to the filter

tag.name: param
tag.description: options to be passed to the filter. Passed options we be passed to the function. -'default_return' mixed: If no filter is return, the data passed in by default will be return. Can be overriden -'event' string: An event to associate with the filter. Default is null

tag.name: return
tag.description: $data The data the function returns

docblock.description: Checks if a filter has been set.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The class the filter is in

tag.name: param
tag.description: The method of the class that the filter is in

docblock.description: Remove all the filters from a class.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The class the filter is in

tag.name: param
tag.description: The method of the class that the filter is in

docblock.description: Adapters allows a method to be completely overwritten by calling a different class with the same method name. Adapters can also be used with closures. The adapter uses a strategy/adapter design pattern.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The class that contains the function the adapter will respond too

tag.name: param
tag.description: The method called that will have the adapter to be called.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The new class to be called that has the same method name

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of options that be called -'object' string : Assumes that default method in the class to be called is static. If called object needs to be instantiated, change to object to 'instance' and one will be created before the adapter calls the function -'call_method' string: By default the method to be called to override the current one should be the same name. But this can be ovveridden to call a different method. -'type' string: The type of method being called. Default is class_method but if the method is a closure, set the type to be 'closure' and make the $trigger_method the closure

tag.name: todo
tag.description: add ability to adapt singleton class

docblock.description: Will add an adapter for every method in the trigger_class to another class. The method will only be adapted to another class if the method in the trigger class has an adapter. This functionality can be very similiar to DI.

tag.name: param
tag.description: This can either be the name of the class or an object whose methods will be adapted to another class. The class should be included or be autoloaded by this point.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The call class is the classes methods that will be called in place of the methods in the trigger_class. These class does not have to be included as this point.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Options that be used to further distinguish the behavior of the adapters added -'object' string: Determines if the object being adapted to is static or an instance.Default is static -'call_class' string: The name of the class that the methods will be adapted too. -'class' string: The name of the whose methods will be adapted to another class

tag.name: todo
tag.description: Add ability to use singleton classes

docblock.description: Calls an adapter for this class. The easiest way of implementing an adapter is by placing the adapter at the top of the function that it is being called in. An infinite amout of parameters can be passed to the adapter BUT the parameters should be the same as the parents.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the class the adapter is in

tag.name: param
tag.description: THe name of the method the class is being called from.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An infiniate amout of parameters to passed to this class.

tag.name: return
tag.description: $value A value that the adapter returns

docblock.description: Checks if an adapter is set for the function.

tag.name: param
tag.description: class The associated class the function is calling

tag.name: param
tag.description: The associated method

tag.name: return
tag.description: $hasAdapter Returns true if it has an adapter or false if it doesn not

docblock.description: Removes an adapter.

tag.name: param
tag.description: class The associated class the function is calling

tag.name: param
tag.description: The associated method

docblock.description: Removes an adapter for an entire class.

tag.name: param
tag.description: class The associated class the function is calling

docblock.description: Adds an observer to the class. Observer events can fired in any method to trigger a response.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the event that will cause a certain class and method to fire

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the class that contains the function that will be fired for this event

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the method that will be fired when the event occurs

tag.name: param
tag.description: Options to further the define the firing of an event -'object' string : If the method being called is static, should be set to static. Else set to instance -'class' stinrg : The name of the class to be called. Default is the class that is passed in. -'method' string: The name of the method to be called. Default is the method that is passed in. -'type' string: The type of function being called. Default is class_method but if the function is a closure, set the type to be 'closure' and make the $method the closure

docblock.description: Calls any functions that have been added to the observer if the event is present in the observers array.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the even that occured that will trigger notifies

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of infinite arguements that will passed to each function related to the event

docblock.description: Removes all the observers assoicated with an event.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The event to remove all the observers from

docblock.description: Adds a filter to the class. Filters are for modifying a value within a class and should not interpet the normal flow within the method.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the class the filter is going in

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the method the filter is in

tag.name: param
tag.description: The class that the filter resides in.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The method in the class that the parameters will be passed too.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Options that can be set for further modifying the filter. -'object' string: If the method being called is static, static should be inserted. If its in an instance, 'instance' should be set. Default is set to static. -'event' string: Associate this filter with an event. -'type' string: The type of function being called. Default is class_method but if the function is a closure, set the type to be 'closure' and make the $filter_method the closure

docblock.description: Apply a fitler if filter is set.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the class the filter is in

tag.name: param
tag.description: The method the filter is in

tag.name: param
tag.description: The data that is being passed to the filter

tag.name: param
tag.description: options to be passed to the filter. Passed options we be passed to the function. -'default_return' mixed: If no filter is return, the data passed in by default will be return. Can be overriden -'event' string: An event to associate with the filter. Default is null

tag.name: return
tag.description: $data The data the function returns

docblock.description: Checks if a filter has been set.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The class the filter is in

tag.name: param
tag.description: The method of the class that the filter is in

docblock.description: Remove all the filters from a class.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The class the filter is in

tag.name: param
tag.description: The method of the class that the filter is in

docblock.description: Returns the instance of a class. Used for implementing the singleton design pattern. Class will only be instantiated once.

tag.name: return
tag.description: $instance Returns the instance of a class.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Default is false. If set to true, will trace adatper.

docblock.description: Turn on/off the ability to trace an filter.Turning on will log a filter using PVLog when filter is executed.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Default is false. If set to true, will trace filter.

docblock.description: Turn on/off the ability to trace an observer.Turning on will log an observer using PVLog when the observer is executed.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Default is false. If set to true, will trace observer.

tag.description: The name of the method in the class to be called

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of arguements. Arguements have to be embedded in an array to be called.

docblock.description: PVSession is the class for handling the cookie session information related to the system.
The lifetime of the cookie
The cookie path
The cookie domain
Access the cookie only over an secure connection
Write to the cookie only over an http(s) connection
Encrypt the cookie
The lifetime of the session
The tmp path for the session
The domain for the session
Access the session only over a secure connection
Writes to the session only over an http connection
Encrypt the session data
A collection of items that belong to this class
A collection of dynamically added methods that below to this class
The adapters that have been added
Observers that have been added
Instances for singleton that have added
Intercepting filters that have been added
Boolean for following and logging adapters that have been added
Boolean for following and logging filters that have been added
Boolean for following and logging observers that have been added.
Initializes the static class PVSession. Values passed can be used to set the default cookie options and the default session options.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of values that set how the class functions. -'cookie_path' string: The path where the cookie is to be stored -'cookie_domain' string: The domain the that the cookie resides on -'cookie_secure' boolean: Access the cookie only over an secure connection -'cookie_httponly' boolean: Write to the cookie only over an http(s) connection -'cookie_lifetime' int: The amount of time the cookie is active for -'hash_cookie' boolean :Hash the cookie to its value is not easily readable -'hash_session' _boolean: Has a season so its value is not easily readable -'session_name' string : Name of the current session -'session_lifetime' int: The life time of the session, in seconds -'session_path' string: The path of the session. -'session_domain' string: The domain of the session. Default is current. -'session_secure'boolean: Access the session only over a secure connection -'session_httponly' _boolean: Writes to the session only over an http connection

docblock.description: Write a cookie. Will use default options set in the init. Otherwise cookie parameters can be defined. Objects and arrays passed as values will be serialized.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Key for the value to be written as a cookie

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value to be stored in a cookie.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Options that can change how the cookie is stored. The options passed will override the default options passed in the init -'cookie_path' string: The path where the cookie is to be stored -'cookie_domain' string: The domain the that the cookie resides on -'cookie_secure' boolean: If the cookie is only writable over a secure connection -'cookie_httponly' boolean: If the cookie is only accesible over an http connection -'cookie_lifetime' int: The amount of time the cookie is active for in seconds -'hash_cookie' boolean :Hash the cookie key and its value is not easily readable

docblock.description: Read a value set in a cookie. Objects and arrays thats were serilizaed will be unserialzed and returned.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The key the cookie was saved as

tag.name: param
tag.description: Options thats configure reading the cookie -hash_cookie boolean: If the cookie was hashed, set the value to true

tag.name: return
tag.description: $value The value retrieved from the cookie. Arrays and objects serialized will be unseralized and returned.

docblock.description: Removes a cookie from the system,

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name/key of the current cookie

tag.name: param
tag.description: Options than can be defined to customize the cookie deletion process -'hash_session' _boolean: If the cookie is hashed, use this to delete it. -'cookie_path' string: The path where the cookie is to be stored -'cookie_domain' string: The domain the that the cookie resides on -'cookie_secure' boolean: -'cookie_httponly' boolean:

docblock.description: Write a cookie. Will use default options set in class. otherwise cookie parameters can be defined. Objects and arrays passed as values will be serialized.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The key for the session

tag.name: param
tag.description: value The value that will be stored in the session

tag.name: param
tag.description: options Options that can be changed that will ovveride the values passed in the init -'hash_session' _boolean: Hash a session so its value is not easily readable

docblock.description: Read a value set in a cookie. Objects and arrays thats were serilizaed will be unserialzed and returned.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The key to access the session variable

tag.name: param
tag.description: Options to define how the information is acccessed -'hash_session' _boolean: Hash a session so its value is not easily readable

docblock.description: Remove a session

tag.name: param

docblock.description: Adds an observer to the class. Observer events can fired in any method to trigger a response.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the event that will cause a certain class and method to fire

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the class that contains the function that will be fired for this event

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the method that will be fired when the event occurs

tag.name: param
tag.description: Options to further the define the firing of an event -'object' string : If the method being called is static, should be set to static. Else set to instance -'class' stinrg : The name of the class to be called. Default is the class that is passed in. -'method' string: The name of the method to be called. Default is the method that is passed in. -'type' string: The type of function being called. Default is class_method but if the function is a closure, set the type to be 'closure' and make the $method the closure

tag.description: An array of infinite arguements that will passed to each function related to the event

docblock.description: Adds a filter to the class. Filters are for modifying a value within a class and should not interpet the normal flow within the method.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the class the filter is going in

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the method the filter is in

tag.name: param
tag.description: The class that the filter resides in.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The method in the class that the parameters will be passed too.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Options that can be set for further modifying the filter. -'object' string: If the method being called is static, static should be inserted. If its in an instance, 'instance' should be set. Default is set to static. -'event' string: Associate this filter with an event. -'type' string: The type of function being called. Default is class_method but if the function is a closure, set the type to be 'closure' and make the $filter_method the closure

docblock.description: Apply a fitler if filter is set.

tag.description: The method the filter is in

tag.description: The data that is being passed to the filter

tag.name: param
tag.description: options to be passed to the filter. Passed options we be passed to the function. -'default_return' mixed: If no filter is return, the data passed in by default will be return. Can be overriden -'event' string: An event to associate with the filter. Default is null

tag.description: $data The data the function returns

docblock.description: Adapters allows a method to be completely overwritten by calling a different class with the same method name. Adapters can also be used with closures. The adapter uses a strategy/adapter design pattern.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The class that contains the function the adapter will respond too

tag.name: param
tag.description: The method called that will have the adapter to be called.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The new class to be called that has the same method name

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of options that be called -'object' string : Assumes that default method in the class to be called is static. If called object needs to be instantiated, change to object to 'instance' and one will be created before the adapter calls the function -'call_method' string: By default the method to be called to override the current one should be the same name. But this can be ovveridden to call a different method. -'type' string: The type of method being called. Default is class_method but if the method is a closure, set the type to be 'closure' and make the $trigger_method the closure

tag.name: todo
tag.description: add ability to adapt singleton class

docblock.description: Will add an adapter for every method in the trigger_class to another class. The method will only be adapted to another class if the method in the trigger class has an adapter. This functionality can be very similiar to DI.

tag.name: param
tag.description: This can either be the name of the class or an object whose methods will be adapted to another class. The class should be included or be autoloaded by this point.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The call class is the classes methods that will be called in place of the methods in the trigger_class. These class does not have to be included as this point.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Options that be used to further distinguish the behavior of the adapters added -'object' string: Determines if the object being adapted to is static or an instance.Default is static -'call_class' string: The name of the class that the methods will be adapted too. -'class' string: The name of the whose methods will be adapted to another class

tag.name: todo
tag.description: Add ability to use singleton classes

docblock.description: Calls an adapter for this class. The easiest way of implementing an adapter is by placing the adapter at the top of the function that it is being called in. An infinite amout of parameters can be passed to the adapter BUT the parameters should be the same as the parents.

tag.description: Options that can be set for further modifying the filter. -'object' string: If the method being called is static, static should be inserted. Default is class_method but if the function is a closure, set the type to be 'closure' and make the $filter_method the closure

docblock.description: PVPatterns is the parent class for implementing Adapters, Observers, Intercepting Filters and Singletons on static methods.
docblock.long-description: Prodgiyview comes with 4 design patterns that can be extended to any object: Adapters, Observers, Intercepting Filters and Singletons. By extending this class to any object that uses static methods, they will have the capability of using these design patterns.

docblock.description: The adapters that have been added
Observers that have been added
Instances for singleton that have added
Intercepting filters that have been added
Boolean for following and logging adapters that have been added
Boolean for following and logging filters that have been added
Boolean for following and logging observers that have been added.

Adapters allows a method to be completely overwritten by calling a different class with the same method name. Adapters can also be used with closures. The adapter uses a strategy/adapter design pattern.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The class that contains the function the adapter will respond too

tag.name: param
tag.description: The method called that will have the adapter to be called.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The new class to be called that has the same method name

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of options that be called -'object' string : Assumes that default method in the class to be called is static. If called object needs to be instantiated, change to object to 'instance' and one will be created before the adapter calls the function -'call_method' string: By default the method to be called to override the current one should be the same name. But this can be ovveridden to call a different method. -'type' string: The type of method being called. Default is class_method but if the method is a closure, set the type to be 'closure' and make the $trigger_method the closure

tag.name: todo
tag.description: add ability to adapt singleton class

docblock.description: Will add an adapter for every method in the trigger_class to another class. The method will only be adapted to another class if the method in the trigger class has an adapter. This functionality can be very similiar to DI.

tag.name: param
tag.description: This can either be the name of the class or an object whose methods will be adapted to another class. The class should be included or be autoloaded by this point.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The call class is the classes methods that will be called in place of the methods in the trigger_class. These class does not have to be included as this point.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Options that be used to further distinguish the behavior of the adapters added -'object' string: Determines if the object being adapted to is static or an instance.Default is static -'call_class' string: The name of the class that the methods will be adapted too. -'class' string: The name of the whose methods will be adapted to another class

tag.name: todo
tag.description: Add ability to use singleton classes

docblock.description: Calls an adapter for this class. The easiest way of implementing an adapter is by placing the adapter at the top of the function that it is being called in. An infinite amout of parameters can be passed to the adapter BUT the parameters should be the same as the parents.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the class the adapter is in

tag.name: param
tag.description: THe name of the method the class is being called from.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An infiniate amout of parameters to passed to this class.

tag.name: return
tag.description: $value A value that the adapter returns

docblock.description: Checks if an adapter is set for the function.

tag.name: param
tag.description: class The associated class the function is calling

tag.name: param
tag.description: The associated method

tag.name: return
tag.description: $hasAdapter Returns true if it has an adapter or false if it doesn not

docblock.description: Adds an observer to the class. Observer events can fired in any method to trigger a response.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the event that will cause a certain class and method to fire

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the class that contains the function that will be fired for this event

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the method that will be fired when the event occurs

tag.name: param
tag.description: Options to further the define the firing of an event -'object' string : If the method being called is static, should be set to static. Else set to instance -'class' stinrg : The name of the class to be called. Default is the class that is passed in. -'method' string: The name of the method to be called. Default is the method that is passed in. -'type' string: The type of function being called. Default is class_method but if the function is a closure, set the type to be 'closure' and make the $method the closure

docblock.description: Calls any functions that have been added to the observer if the event is present in the observers array.

tag.description: The name of the even that occured that will trigger notifies

tag.description: An array of infinite arguements that will passed to each function related to the event
